Package me.neo.randomtwistcore.api.twists

Class Twist

java.lang.Object
me.neo.randomtwistcore.api.twists.Twist
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
Direct Known Subclasses:
ItemTwist
public abstract class Twist extends Object implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
This class encompasses all backend logic of RTC and can also be extended to make custom twists.

  • Method Details

    • isBound

      public static boolean isBound(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, Twist twist)
      Checks if the player is bound to the specified twist.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to check.
      twist - The Twist to check.
      Returns:
      True if the player is bound to the twist. False otherwise.

    • isBound

      public boolean isBound(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Returns if the player is bound to the twist. This method is to be used in classes that extend twist.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to check.
      Returns:
      If the player is bound.

    • Get

      @Nullable public static <T extends Twist> Twist Get(Class<T> t)
      Tries to get the Twist associated with the class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The Twist's runtime class.
      Parameters:
      t - The Twist's runtime class.
      Returns:
      The twist attached to the class or null if none was found.

    • Get

      @Nullable public static Twist Get(String name)
      Tries to get the Twist associated with the name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the twist.
      Returns:
      The twist associated with the name or null if none was found.

    • Get

      @Nullable public static Twist Get(int id)
      Tries to get the Twist associated with the id.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the twist.
      Returns:
      The twist associated with the id or null if none was found.

    • tryRegister

      public static boolean tryRegister(Twist twist, org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      Calls RegisterTwistEvent and tries to register a twist. If the event was cancelled the twist will not be registered. If a twist was registered after the plugin was enabled the twist will not show up inside the command pool. The functionality, however, will still persist.
      Parameters:
      twist - The Twist to register.
      plugin - The Plugin that this twist is being registered from.
      Returns:
      True if it registered. False otherwise.

    • tryUnregister

      public static boolean tryUnregister(Twist twist)
      Calls UnregisterTwistEvent and tries to unregister a twist. If the event was cancelled the twist will not be unregistered. This will not remove the twist from the command pool as those are statically generated upon enabling the plugin. Unregistering a twist will automatically unbind all players from the twist but will not call PlayerUnbindEvent as the twist has been removed. This will call UnregisterTwistEvent
      Parameters:
      twist - The Twist to unregister.
      Returns:
      True if the twist was unregistered. False otherwise.

    • tryBind

      public static boolean tryBind(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, Twist twist)
      Calls PlayerBindTwistEvent and tries to bind a player to a twist. If the event was cancelled the player will not be bound.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to bind.
      twist - The Twist to bind the player to.
      Returns:
      True if the player was successfully bound. False otherwise.

    • tryUnbind

      public static boolean tryUnbind(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, Twist twist, boolean unregistered)
      Calls PlayerBindTwistEvent and tries to unbind a player from a twist. If the event was cancelled the player will not be unbound.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player to unbind.
      twist - The Twist to unbind the player from.
      unregistered - If the players were unbound because a twist was unregistered.
      Returns:
      True if the player was successfully unbound. False otherwise.

    • onRegister

      protected void onRegister()
      Called when a twist is registered. Mainly used for debugging.

    • onUnregister

      protected void onUnregister()
      Called when a twist is unregistered. Mainly used for debugging.
